Summary: Orange, glowing, silent object at 60 degrees NE of witness, headed from N to S, seen transiting 40+ degrees in approx. 25 seconds
trends: There have been 8 other sightings in Fairfield
There were no other sightings in Fairfield on or around July 2nd 2011
This sighting has never been favorited.
divs: Sighting DetailsThis sighting is reported on CMS by Investigator Beverly Trout, as reported to Iowa MUFON by the reporting witness. On Saturday night, July 2, 2011, at about 9:40 p.m., reporting witness saw an orange, glowing object for an estimated 25 SECONDS, which looked angular on one side (see sketch attached), at about 60 degrees up as she drove E on an E-W street in her town of approx. 9,500 population. The next night her daughter-in-law contacted her to say that several family members who'd gotten together on Sunday night, 7-3-11, discovered that they'd all seen something from their various locations in surrounding communities the night before for SEVERAL MINUTES, but the daughter-in-law reported that what they saw was WHITE, not orange and glowing, as seen by this reporting witness. Also, their sightings were at 9:30 p.m., which appears to indeed match the passage of the International Space Station (ISS) as seen from that area, but does not explain what was seen by this reporting witness. Witness lost sight of object because of surrounding vegetation. After arriving home, she now thinks it's odd that she forgot about it until the next night when her daughter-in-law texted her re the various family members having seen something from various locations in surrounding communities. (INVESTIGATOR NOTE: Reporting witness' "forgetting" the incident until the next night is what is known in UFO research as an INAPPROPRIATE RESPONSE IN THE PRESENCE OF HIGH STRANGENESS.)
